Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Getting cell values is returning different format - OpenXML" (#1413) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
Getting cell value returns many decimal places. 

**Screenshots**
I have this "4.9" value in excel
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15882382/233115011-f9670d58-d641-427b-aee0-b85eb9f60344.png)

When retrieving the cell value in OpenXML. 4.9 was stored as 4.90000000000000000000004. It should return value as it was inputted.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15882382/233115315-e6777836-f800-487f-b40e-389be4b6cd2f.png)


**To Reproduce**
// Please add a self-contained, minimum viable repro of the issue.
// If you require external resources, please provide a gist or GitHub repro
// An Xunit style test is preferred, but a console application would work too.

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Observed behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. Windows]
 - Office version [e.g. 16.0.15427.20178]
 - .NET Target: (e.g. .NET Framework, .NET Core, UWP, Xamarin...)
 - DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: (e.g. 2.11.0)

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "After AddWorkbookPart() I recieved "Cannot retrieve parts of writeonly container" Exception from System.IO.Packaging" (#1809) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
Recently I updated OpenXML from 2.18.0 to 3.1.0.
The function AddWorkbookPart() didn't work anymore. 
Always get the System.IO.IOException "Cannot retrieve parts of writeonly container".

**Screenshots**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/59a63504-4b01-4a79-b859-ed0a99cfdf9e)

Anyone knows the problem?
